abstract.para: This file provides documentation for file 94boct02.dat, a comma delimited file that contains rhodamine WT (RWT) and bromide concentrations over time at two sites on the Blueberry Creek (New Reach 1994) July 2, 1994.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Solute injection to the reach was made between NA1 and NA2, 165meters downsteam of the Lake I8 outlet. Samples were collected at NA7 and NA10, 299m and 785m downstream of the injection site.

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATA RECEIVED: June 1997 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Karie Slavik DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: DATA:

para.literalLayout: Co-injection of NaBr and Rhodamine WT was made 165 meters downstream of the Lake I8 outlet. The channel locations were instrumented with Orion bromide selective electrodes to monitor instream bromide concentrations and guide the collection of physical samples. Samples were collected borsilicate glass vials at irregular time intervals weighted to cover the rising and falling limbs more intensively than other time periods. Rhodamine WT concentrations were read on a Turner Designs Model 111 fluorometer. Bromide concentrations were analyzed by HPLC on a Dionex AS4A Anion column with a detection limit of 10 ug/L. Injection Start: 0 minutes Injection End: 264 minutes

Notes: (11) VARIABLE DESCRIPTIONS: Precis. Coded? Missing Variable Variable Description Units (Y/N) Values Site site of measurements y n D/D distance from RWT/NaBr dripper 5m n n Date date dd-mmm-yy n n Location Sampling location n n ET elapse time minutes n n RWT RWT concentration mg/L n y Br Bromide conc. mg/L n y Comments Comments

Reference Citations: Kilpatrick,F.A. and Cobb,E.D. 1985. Measurement of discharge using tracers. Techniques of Water-Resource Investigations of the United States Geological Survey. Stream Solute Workshop 1990. Concepts and methods for assessing solute dynamics in stream ecosystems. J. N. Amer. Benthol. Soc., 9(2):95-119.
